reviewText:
Polish political commentary in the form of a platformer. Do I understand any of it? No. Is it a good game? Not really. The controls are floaty and the areas are pretty poorly thought up and designed.

Should have been a free flash game. The target audience isn't the steam userbase anyway.

edit: if the dev makes it moddable so I can put Trump in instead of Korwin, I'll change this to a positive review

reviewText: Nice gameplay, but unfortunately this game would not be understood by many gamers (as you can already see in the reviews); you need to have some basic knowledge of inner political situation in Poland to understand many of these gags. Me myself — I'm a Russian right conservative, and I totally support Janusz Korwin-Mikke and his efforts to save his country from the welfare socialist plague, but unfortunately that's the only reason I give this game a Yes".\n\nIf you don't know anything about Korwin and Poland's lefties
date: you won't enjoy this game as much as I enjoyed it."

reviewText:
Well well look what I found here. A genuine kusoge.

First of all, Korwin is a real life Polish Political Member (More info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janusz_Korwin-Mikke)
You play as Korwin in this action platformer game. I don't really know about Polish Political situation. But as indicated in the game. They hate communism (Communism logo used as electric trap), hate gay/lesbian, hate p*nis, etc. There are many hate in this game.
They use Star Wars credits roll as their intro for the story that doesn't make any senses.
The enemies seems to be in a politic too as Korwin enemy.

For the game itself, I feel like playing a stupid unfinished flash game.
That's it.

reviewText: I like the idea, I think it's quirky, but this game is kinda unenjoyable. The jumping is really awful. You have to wait to be able to jump again for a while after you land, and you sometimes it's hard to jump out of places, so you get stuck. It's also hard to differentiate the background from interact-able foreground objects.

date: commonly known as the "New Right" (Nowa Prawica)
recommended: with his quest to annihilate the opressive threat of the ever-corrupt lefties. Straight away I can tell you if you know the context of this game
hoursPlayed: and know a decent bit about polish/european politics
voteText: then you should take this game into consideration when on sale.\n\nTo give a little background from someone who is decently engaged in the Polish political scene
helpfulPercent: and someone who was born in Poland
votesHelpful: Korwin has been known to be one of the notable far-right wing/eurosceptic/anti-establishment/libertarian figures in Europe that have been actively seen as controversial due to statements made during the path of his career
votesTotal: and generally irrational and strong beliefs that don't necassarily adhere to the political status-quo. (semi-related figures from the west: Nigel Farage
commentsCount: Donald Trump) How he differs from quite a lot of other figures is that
column16: (in my opinion) quite a lot of the statements he makes are grossly spun out of context and overall exaggerated by biased media outlets
column18: and that his ideas are quite agreeable with and  he can be quite a reasonable character
column19: very strong in his delivery and very blunt and to the point
column20: without being too edgy or too stupid in what he says.\n\nWhile I personally agree with quite a lot of the ideas he puts forward (disdain for the nanny state of the European Union and it's establishment
column23: he is still an edgy character
column24: and thus this game has spawned
column25: in a goal to destroy the countless threats engrossing Poland
column26: with various references to the political situation in Poland. Enemies being various figures seen in the media
column28: such as the ever infamous "Mohair Berets"
column29: the tongue in cheek term for the conservative
column30: devout catholic demographic of elderly women. Another example is one of the bosses in the game is Jaroslaw Kaczynski (chairman of the PiS party
column32: aka. Law and Justice) an infamous figure in the political scene.\n\nAs for the game itself
column35: cheaply thrown together platformer that is somewhat repetitive. The terminology of "old-school" is somewhat appropriate
column36: adhereing to low-budget platformers and flash games. Controls are finnicky
column38: etc. etc.\n\nNow obviously I understand should you turn yourself away from this game
column39: should you not care for the context and the references
column42: and the only reason why I recommend this game is because it is decently funny and a decent play for the people that understand the satirical content. If you do however

reviewText:
Vey nice, simple, short 2d platform game about Janusz Korwin-Mikke, Polish right-wing politic, who fights against socialists. Because ♥♥♥♥ socialism xD

It's very challenging. Levels are hard, at least for me. I had a challenge. Gameplay looks like every other platform game, but I like it. It's fun.
You will encounter many bad creatures, like for example: Kwaśniewski, Palikot, Grodzka/Grodzki/Grodzkie/whatever you call this thing, Rydzyk, Jaruzelski, Kaczyński, Tusk etc. Enemies are fun. Levels are fun too. But you must know Polish political scene to understand the humour of this game.

Completing this game will take you from 1 hour to max 2 hours, depending on how good in platform games you are. So it's very short, but I think it's worth its small price. So I recommend Korwin The Game.
